title: What do you think of ppl not speaking English?
body:
When in B/P someone begin chatting in Chinese, I reply him in Chinese. That’s what I do. This kind of conversation seems not liked by some sensitive guys. 
Last rank game I had 4 Chinese in my team and 3 of them were talking in Chinese about role swaps when idiot jg interrupted: English or I play teemo. One guy asked in English: can I jg? And he received no response from jg. Then I joined their talking in Chinese because I wanted to get the swap done quickly using my first langue, and the jungler seems  not willing to swap so it doesn’t matter.
Then in the game the jg begin inting, trolling and trash talking. I told him he to stop trolling otherwise get 4x report and he replied like: So surprised you actually speak English!
I’ve experienced similar cases, so can anyone pls tell me does speaking another language in the game hurt other’s feeling? Or it’s just I met an asshole?

replies.body:
This whole thread is retarded (and I mean the word in it's actual (original) definition, the opposite of advanced).

1) There is no such language as 'Chinese'. Cantonese or Mandarin please, they are different things. This is like saying 'American' is a language.

2) OCE is an Oceanic server, not Australian (although that is where it is based). There are many languages spoken in the Oceanic region. There is no such thing as an 'English language OCE server', so stop using that as a point of debate. I know people from all over the world, that speak many different languages, just on my street alone.

3) I've been the 5th on a premade of 4 Chinese (people, not language... see argument #1). I just say, "speak English or I mute you all". Problem solved. If you know how to play and watch a minimap at the same time, you really don't need to tell them how much you love scented candles.

TBH, im sick of seeing chinese in my games, not because im racist but because they never speak english, and the only things they ever say is AU dog, or OCE trash etc.

Now, im fully capable of using google translate, but in a game that requires split second decision making, you can't do that...

So, my standpoint is one of two things either:

1. go back to CH/KR/Whatever Server you came from and get off of OCE (Unless you're willing to say more than just spewing insults at the other OCE players)
2. Don't play solo's, make sure you have a premade that speaks your language

Alternatively, if you're not gonna do either of these things, at least don't talk, use pings instead

Pings are straight forward. But communication is needed for complex tactics and role swaps.

Mostly, I would speak English in game because I assume everyone in game knows English. 

But I would prefer efficient communication in Chinese if the conversation is not necessary to be understood by others. Like, I am telling the top play safe and not to dive alone, when I know he speaks Chinese as well.

The trash talkers you met are very likely to be toxic in their own server as well. And it's likely that their English is poor so that he can only express their dissatisfaction with one or two abuse words.

Ok, lets view this from a different perspective. 

In a group environment, people tend to care more if everyones speak the same langue they do. Otherwise what are you in that group? a 3rd wheel? You dont know if they're insulting you, or understand you, ECT...

Imagine if you've being put in a team of 5 at work, and 3 of your team member is speaking in their own langue; The group has now become 2 different  sub group. You cant even call that a group any more. On one hand you have these guys that is speaking in their langue, while you and yours speaking another. The end result is 5 people that cant work well together. 

I dont like it when people come to an english server, and cant even understand, or use the langue. Japanese games are notorious for regions block and banning non japanese speakers, so their own player base **dont feel unwelcome**. 

If this forum have people writing in their own langue and start posting. It would anger a lot of english speakers. Rightly so, cant socialise with people you dont understand.

The scenario in question though, it wasn't a matter of them being unable to communicate in English, it was them choosing to use a language others on their team understood to more quickly and effectively communicate something between *those players* who understood.

Even if that were not the case, what if you are on holiday? Visiting family? Should you be denied your pastimes just because you don't speak the language? The game remains the same, the pings the same. If you *needed* chat for effective communication, there would be arguments for ranked, but normals? Given that you can communicate basically everything with pings, there is really no argument at all.

Should players on chat restrictions or who unbind their enter key not be allowed to play? Should we be denying mute people service at restaurants while we're at it?

This is more on the side of repetitive encounters and being alienated from the group. If the team is winning, NO PROBLEM, not many would care as much. 

But let's be realistic here. When people are on a losing streak, or in a losing game. The hatred carries over from one game to the next. Get Amplified by repeated bad experiences. All of a sudden it's not, **That **bastard. But, **Those **bastard again; Kind of ordeal.

It is already a hardship trying for the win, with piles of problems team mates can bring. Let's not add, refusing to communicate to the list.
